div.div: This file is designed to work with data files pasted in. If you upload data files you will need to change the filesnames in this mothur command file to match the filenames of the data files you upload.

Example data (click on [use example data] to load): cluster(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, method=furthest) get.oturep(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, fasta=Both.trim.pick.fasta, list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) collect.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) make.shared(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, group=dat4.pick.data) collect.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, calc=bootstrap-jack-ace-chao-sobs, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05, calc=bootstrap-sobs) remove.rare(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, nseqs=1) summary.shared(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.pick.shared, calc=sharedsobs-jclass-morisitahorn, label=0.01-0.03-0.05)

div.pre: cluster(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, method=furthest) get.oturep(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, fasta=Both.trim.pick.fasta, list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) collect.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) make.shared(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, group=dat4.pick.data) collect.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, calc=bootstrap-jack-ace-chao-sobs, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05, calc=bootstrap-sobs) remove.rare(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, nseqs=1) summary.shared(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.pick.shared, calc=sharedsobs-jclass-morisitahorn, label=0.01-0.03-0.05)

Database file (if pasted will be named dat5.data, if uploaded will keep the same filename)

xhtml:div.title: This parameter is mandatory
xhtml:div.xhtml:span: Name of input file for the Fungal ITS Extractor. This should be the first part of your fasta file + .unique. + the file extention

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: If you change this parameter, change the filenames in the mothur commands below to match.

This file is designed to work with data files pasted in. If you upload data files you will need to change the filesnames in this mothur command file to match the filenames of the data files you upload.

xhtml:div.title: This parameter is mandatory
xhtml:div.xhtml:span: The file extention of the input for Esprit_CC (the filename is set by "File to process" above)

Number of kmer-dist blocks (will use (n+1 choose 2) processors). The esprit algorithm is parallelized, meaning the input is broken into multiple parts and those parts are processed simultaneously on multiple computers. This parameter controls how many parts the input is broken into. For most datasets you can leave it at 10. If you are running just a few sequences, you need to make sure that the parameter is less than the number of sequences you have so that there will be more than just 1 or 2 sequences in each block. If you have a very large dataset that's taking too long to run you can try raising it. Do not set it higher than 15 though, since 16 choose 2 is already 120

xhtml:div.title: This parameter is mandatory
xhtml:div.xhtml:span: Number of needledist runs (will use n processors)
The file extension of the output file from Espritdist2dist3 (the filename is set by "File to process" above)

parameter.example: trim.seqs(fasta=Both.fasta, minlength=400) chimera.uchime(fasta=Both.trim.fasta, reference=dat5.data) remove.seqs(accnos=Both.trim.uchime.accnos, fasta=Both.trim.fasta) list.seqs(fasta=Both.trim.pick.fasta) get.seqs(accnos=Both.trim.pick.accnos, name=dat1.names) list.seqs(name=dat1.pick.names) get.seqs(accnos=dat1.pick.accnos, group=dat4.data)

interface.label: The file extention of the input for Esprit_CC (the filename is set by "File to process" above)

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.span: The file extention of the input for Esprit_CC (the filename is set by "File to process" above)

parameter.name: kmerblocks
parameter.prompt: Number of kmer-dist blocks (will use (n+1 choose 2) processors). The esprit algorithm is parallelized, meaning the input is broken into multiple parts and those parts are processed simultaneously on multiple computers. This parameter controls how many parts the input is broken into. For most datasets you can leave it at 10. If you are running just a few sequences, you need to make sure that the parameter is less than the number of sequences you have so that there will be more than just 1 or 2 sequences in each block. If you have a very large dataset that's taking too long to run you can try raising it. Do not set it higher than 15 though, since 16 choose 2 is already 120

div.span: Number of kmer-dist blocks (will use (n+1 choose 2) processors). The esprit algorithm is parallelized, meaning the input is broken into multiple parts and those parts are processed simultaneously on multiple computers. This parameter controls how many parts the input is broken into. For most datasets you can leave it at 10. If you are running just a few sequences, you need to make sure that the parameter is less than the number of sequences you have so that there will be more than just 1 or 2 sequences in each block. If you have a very large dataset that's taking too long to run you can try raising it. Do not set it higher than 15 though, since 16 choose 2 is already 120

parameter.name: espritdist2dist3infilename
parameter.prompt: The file extension of the output file from Espritdist2dist3 (the filename is set by "File to process" above)

format.code: " % espritdist2dist3 -f " + str(whichfile) + str(eccinfileext) + " -d " + str(whichfile) + ".trim.ndist @ " + str(whichfile) + str(value)

parameter.example: cluster(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, method=furthest) get.oturep(column=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist, name=dat1.pick.names, fasta=Both.trim.pick.fasta, list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) collect.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) make.shared(list=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.list, group=dat4.pick.data) collect.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) summary.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, calc=bootstrap-jack-ace-chao-sobs, label=0.01-0.03-0.05) rarefaction.single(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, freq=1, label=0.01-0.03-0.05, calc=bootstrap-sobs) remove.rare(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.shared, nseqs=1) summary.shared(shared=Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.fn.pick.shared, calc=sharedsobs-jclass-morisitahorn, label=0.01-0.03-0.05)

jobState.name: http://snap.hpc.ncsu.edu/mobyle/data/services/servers/local/programs/sanger_otu_clustering_workflow.xml
jobState.commandLine: runner mothur commandfile1.data % /opt/mobyle/bin/FungalITSextractor.pl dat1.unique.data /opt/mobyle/bin/HMMs/ % java -jar /opt/mobyle/bin/ParseFungalITS.jar outdata.csv dat1.unique.data % mothur commandfile2.data % run-esprit-cc-no-preproc -w -v 1.0 -i Both.trim.pick.fasta 10 100 % mv sequence.ndist Both.trim.ndist % espritdist2dist3 -f Both.trim.pick.fasta -d Both.trim.ndist @ Both.trim.pick.dist2dist3.ndist % mothur commandfile3.data
